intro: Acer oblongum var. oblongum, commonly known as the European maple, is a deciduous tree native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that turn vibrant yellow in autumn. The tree typically grows to a height of 15–25 meters, with a broad, rounded canopy. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, appearing in early spring before the leaves emerge. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
